title: How to finish the full syllabus for an exam overnight - Quora

response.answer_text: Lol. You can do this, but it’s bad that you have to do this. Now I am assuming that you have atleast read your chapters once and you are planning to revise everything thoroughly for the exam. Normally there are 15 chapters for any major exam and that is what I am considering. So you are about to start at night, say 8:00 pm. You are all motivated to complete the syllabus till 8 in the morning, so here you go! Start with the most difficult chapters. Keep a timer with you and give 3 or 4 minutes to each page, depending upon your speed. I assume there are 4 chapters which are most difficult for you. Complete them until 2 am. Now take a 15 min thorough rest. By thorough, I mean no using mobile. Drink water, use the washroom, go to the balcony or just sit and rest. Next, take the theory chapters. Don’t read everything. Go to the internet and borrow notes of the theory chapters. Usually only some selected questions come from theory chapters, so go read them. Complete 4 theory chapters until 4 am. Now take the moderate chapters. Again, don’t study everything. Skip the introductions, the extra knowledge boxes, and everything you feel unimportant or hasn’t been asked before. Read only the imporant topics and complete each chapter in 30 to 45 minutes. In this way, you can complete the remaining 7 chapters till 8 am. -If this is too tough, make it light for yourself. It is not necessary to complete the whole of your syllabus. You can score 90% by completing 70% of your syllabus, but wisely. -Take breaks. Apply the POMODORO method. Read for 25 mins and take a 5 mins break. -Be motivated till the end to complete your syllabus. Find that one thing that instantly motivates you if you feel a bit dizzy. -Drink lots of water and don’t sit on bed. Believe that you can do it and you will definitely do it.

Just what I did in the last two weeks!  Okay. You need to be a little pragmatic at this time. Trying to cover the whole syllabus is a little far-fetched. Try and complete at least 60% of the syllabus. Of course you can study more but focus on the 60% first. Talk to some sincere student (there's always one in each class) and ask about the easiest and the most scoring chapters to study. First hurdle crossed, now you know where to start from. Good, moving on.Next step. You need notes. Trouble that sincere student a little more. You may have to bribe him with promises of treats. Do not hesitate, do not be a miser at this time. You need him/her, you need to pass, if it takes buying 2 pizzas in exchange of notes so be it. If you have to beg a little and involve in shameless flattery, do that. If everything goes well, you'll have the notes by now.Remember pain is temporary, gpa is forever. Write this statement down where you can see it, make it your phone's/laptop's wallpaper, set it as the contact picture of the people you frequently talk to. No distractions. Get off Quora, go go now. Uninstall Whatsapp, don't use Facebook/YouTube/Buzzfeed. It's just a few days, you don't need anything that doesn't let you study.Smart work will be more fruitful than hard work at this point. Go through last years question papers. Some topics are almost always repeated. Make sure you prepare them well. You might find some topics that go above your head as you panic due to lack of time. It's OK, breathe, call someone who knows those topics and ask them to explain it to you. If they're not a nice person and refuse to do so, blurt out things like "If I fail, it'll be on your conscience, how will you forgive yourself."Load up on Coffee and just get to it. Study as much as you can, as fast as you can. Sacrifice sleep, 2-3 hours is enough, you can sleep after the exam. Send a little prayer out to whatever you believe in and hope for the best. All the best to you.

See this is an everyday routine of engineers in India and you shouldn’t feel disheartened first of all cos pessimism will be your downfall. We engineering students do it in every exams and normally pass with decent grades (I know some toppers who study last day as well eg this asshole: Shaswat Rungta).Now turn off the quora and see what the syllabus is. Now this depends on you whether you want to complete full syllabus or just a part of it.(I am telling you what I do)Either way, turn on some decent music (if you don’t have a playlist goto 8tracks and find some nice playlist. Eg. http://8tracks.com/misjudgementss/studying or http://8tracks.com/ashibie/study-time etc.)  And start studying. Point down anything you think is important in a blank paper. If you think it’s more than just a point then bookmark the page on that book or note book.Try to make flow chart of each and every process. Remembering texts is always difficult as compared to remembering images or flow diagrams.Read every headline properly and do light to moderate reading of every paragraph. The topic which is marked important should be read rigorously.Do this till syllabus is over or there are 3 hrs left for your exam(whichever is earlier). Take a nap of around half an hour or so. Take a proper bath and then when you have just 1 and a half hour left, read rigorously the notes you made while you were studying(the blank sheets). DO NOT UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES STUDY A NEW TOPIC AT THIS TIME.All the best and enjoy your paper, cos the more tension you have the worse you will perform in the exam. All the best :)

You can start with calculating the time left for your exam and divide your syllabus accordingly.Ideally it would be : 12 hours left, 12 chapters to go, 1 hour for each chapter!6 hours later, phew managed to finish half of it.. Let's take a break and get back.Last hour: I'm almost done, let me just skip the last chapter and start revising. And practically, it would be: 12 hours left, 12 chapters to go, 1 hour for each chapter!6 hours later, 12 chapters left, I can still do 2 chapters in an hour!2 hours left : " F*** this shit!!" But then again you'd somehow manage to get back to books only because you wouldn't wanna fail!Last hour: If only I had 12 more hours, I would've finished the syllabus!XD In simple words, one can only dream of finishing the entire syllabus overnight!:P

Well it is possible, but to be sincere it depends on the exam subjects and level of education. A high school student may be able to finish a syllabus overnight but an undergraduate may not be able to do so. Another factor is that it depends on your level of understanding. If you have read the syllabus before then it is very much easier for you to finish the full syllabus overnight, because there are some cases where students have exams consequently and students still tends to perform well. So it is possible if you have read the syllabus before or if you are a fast learner. But if those two are not applicable to you, then i will suggest you should read and understand the topics that you can and make sure you can solve any questions on it. It is better to be able to solve 3 questions out of 5 questions than trying to solve 5 question and unfortunately end up with zero. Here is an online high school website that maybe helpful to you Online High School - Acadel

These tricks might help you.   Skim through the headings, and make a note of them. Don't go into the in-depth matter. Remember the key points for an answer. The remaining filling can be done by your creativity.There will always be stock questions in your paper. Learn the important and must know concepts. Leave the stud questions. Keep a pen and a paper beside you, and scribble the points simultaneously. You will retain more this way.Stick to a book, and don't shift between different authors. Believe you can complete the portion, and you can do it.Stay away from distractions. *Sighs, bubye Quora :(Read as if you are reading a novel, and you will be done with the syllabus before you know it! It works, but you won't be entirely satisfied with your performance, and it won't be your best!

Read the points to remember or Summary at the end of each lesson. Already the authors came up with gist of each chapter. So that should be your first shot.  In most of the books, the first chapter is BASICS and last chapter  has ADVANCED topics covered. So cover them first. Read previous year repeated topics/questions.  FIND PATTERNS:From previous questions paper you can make out whether the question comes from first half of the the lesson or second half of the lesson. If a problem has been asked in Lesson 1, then a problem is not asked in Lesson 5. Like this you need to find patterns. But you can't do this the night before exam. But you can do for 3 chapters that will make you pass. But this will help you pass the exam. but you will never gain expertise and knowledge than a person who studied and experienced it for one full semester. He mastered it. You just read  (Cut copy paste) it. LISTEN FROM A FRIENDRather than reading 5 pages and understanding them, hear it from a friend who had already read it. Have you ever wondered why we remember songs. Because we hear them , we don't read the lyrics first.  PS: SivaKumar's answer to How do engineering students prepare for their exams just one night before? SivaKumar's answer to Why does every engineering student start reading just a day before the exam?

Hey buddy! We are the birds which are flocking together! My end sem exams are going through and I haven't read a single word of any of my subjects. Towmorrow morning I have an exam of Microbiology. And I haven't read anything. So here's my strategy: Leave quora, and start studying.Make a list of topics from your syllabus which you need to study and which you don't.Study the important topics.Make flow-charts and diagrams of all the topics and try to learn them.Get a quick revision of the topic by discussing it with your friends. In this you could strenthen your concept, and at the same time could ask your friend to tell you any of the other topic. Two shots at a single blow!Use YouTube to understand any theoreetical topic.Refer to your class notes. In case you lack them then ask for your friend's. If he also doesn't have them, then ask it from a girl. Hope this might have helped you. Best of luck for your exams!

This is something like..How can I become a Grown Up Adult in one single day from the day of my birth...Finishing the full syllabus isn't possible but  you can manage with preparing that portion which would let you clear the exam...Orelse it may be possible when you have your own pre-prepared notes with all the important asps...

The key is preperation. Make an index /summary of every chapter and stick it to the relevant page or write on the margins of your book. Read that.read definitions and formulae. The nioght of the exam is to just see if you recongnise what you read and look through topics you tend to forget or need to jog your memoryThis will allow you to cover your syllabus.You obviously cannot read everythingIf you ahvent read then it is a "Yuddha kaaladhalli shastrabyasa" menaing trying to learn how to use a weapon at the time of war.
First of all! You cant do the whole syllabus overnight but yes you can gain max! Just go through all the topics and take a jist of it what content it contains !! Do definations, laws, formulae…..
Hope this helps. Shreya Gupta's answer to How can I complete my whole syllabus in one day before the exam?
